roomTip: Make sure to wake up early to view the sunrise from the hotel, it’s the most beautiful sight you will see :)
text: Absolutely exceptional and mesmerising stay!! The perfect choice if you are looking for stunning location and views, super tasty food and very professional and comfortable service. Thorough professionals managing this hotel. It was our anniversary and Takshila and Neelaksh made us a beautiful handmade card as well ❤️ The manager and Priyantha ensured we got the perfect experience taking care of every small detail, and celebrating our anniversary with live music performance and even a cake!! Thankyou so much EKHO Ella for making this the most memorable experience for us ❤️
title: Mesmerizing view, perfect location & the most memorable stay we have had!

text:
A small boutique style hotel with a splendid view. There are a few steps to negotiate, but nothing too difficult.
The staff are all friendly and welcoming, and the rooms nicely furnished, with a “zen” like feel. The wi-fi is adequate.
We decided to eat in the restaurant instead of going out, and this was a good decision, as the food was splendid and tasty. Breakfast was also more than ample, all locally sourced.
title: Great vista

I wish i'll be to visit and spend more time at Ekho Ella.

text:
Service - Equivalent to a 5 star hotel if not more. You will be welcomed by the mesmerising flute and a tour airing the hotel. An interesting concept as Tran stations.

Room - They are named after trains. Rooms are well maintained, clean and tidy. The room is spacious and comfortable. You can view the sunrise at the comfort of your bed.

Food - Sanjeewa restaurant provides tasty and great food. 

The view from the hotel is magnificent and like the topping of an ice cream was the service by all the staff, especially too Dinesh Gayashan, Priyantha and I did not get the lady who received us when we arrived.
title: Worth every penny

placeInfo: {'id': '14968612', 'name': 'EKHO Ella', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 637, 'locationString': 'Ella, Uva Province', 'latitude': 6.87107, 'longitude': 81.04919, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g616035-d14968612-Reviews-EKHO_Ella-Ella_Uva_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.ekhohotels.com/ekhoella/', 'address': 'EKHO Ella, Sandungama Rd Ella, Sri Lanka, Ella 90090 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'EKHO Ella, Sandungama Rd Ella, Sri Lanka', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Ella', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '90090'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 2, 'count2': 8, 'count3': 11, 'count4': 55, 'count5': 562}}
text:
My wife and I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights in October 2024.

1.	Good Points
a.	This hotel is situated well 5-10Min walk to bars and restaurants, down the road.
b.	The room and toilet were clean.
c.	The staffs were friendly and very accommodating to our requests.
d.	The hotel has a small bar near the restaurant. The cocktails served was good. This was my personal favorite.
e.	The buffet breakfast had decent amount of food variety, mostly Indian food of course, and it was all tasty.
f.	The jacuzzi in the room was great.
g.	The pillow and bed was just OK, not the greatest, but will do.
h.	The check-in and check-out process was fast.
i.	All the staffs spoke decent to good, English.

2.	Bad Points
a.	I paid USD180 Per Night (including taxes) for the Deluxe Mountain View room. The amenities in the room were somewhat limited.
b.	The hotel does not have a swimming pool. 

3.	Will I return again to this hotel?
Yes, of course.
title: I love This Hotel

roomTip: Wake up early to look out your window to catch the sunrise over Adams Peak
text: From the moment you arrive to the pipe music welcome and are shown out to the wonderful view accompanied by a small refreshing drink you feel relaxed. At some stage during everyone’s stay the hotel manager introduces himself to gauge your needs and satisfaction. This unique, boutique hotel with only 14 rooms has staff that are always wanting to assist in any way possible. The bedrooms are train carriage themed (which is appropriate given how most tourists arrive). The food is exceptional and the restaurant supervisor Sanjeewa, and the wonderful chef ensured that our vegetarian diet was catered for with   lavish dishes served with flair and presentation. When we came back to Sri Lanka we will return to Ella just to stay at Ekho Ella for the experience.
title: Boutique brilliance.

Namaste

text: EKHO Ella is an absolute gem! Nestled in a stunning historic building, the setting is nothing short of breathtaking, with panoramic views that instantly make you feel at peace. The beauty of the property is matched by the exceptional quality of the food, which is both delicious and beautifully presented—truly a culinary delight. The staff are another highlight; they are incredibly helpful and go above and beyond to ensure you have a wonderful stay. Whether you're here for the history, the food, or the service, EKHO Ella offers an unforgettable experience. Highly recommend! Special shout out to Dinesh,Priyantha,Nilakshi,Thakshila,Sujeewa,Krishan, Sanjeewa and last but not least Janith. Thank you Team you made us have the best holiday.
title: Amazing!!!

text:
This is a boutique hotel in Ella. The room we stayed had a magnificent view both at night and day time. We woke up early to enjoy the sunrise from our room. Dinner was good with sophisticated soft music, the musician played the Bata Nalawa (Sri Lanka flute) beautifully. Hotel staffs are friendly, attentive and care. Try the Avocado on toast at breakfast (I thought only Australian chefs can make good Avocado toasts 😊)

If the tour started from Colombo - Dumballa -  Kandy - Nuwara Eliya - Ella - Yala - Galle - Colombo then I recommend 2 nights stop in this hotel. You will enjoy the stay and recharge for rest of the trip.
title: Wonderful Ekho Ella Hotel

text: Brilliantly located at the end of the Main Street in Ella this beautiful, tranquil, quirky hotel is lovely. The train decor theme is cleverly executed in the rooms and the common areas. Whilst there’s no pool there is a jacuzzi and comfortable seating areas all overlooking Ella rock. The staff and delightful and the breakfast is all made to order. A few steps away is the bustling Main Street with shops, bars and restaurants but at the hotel it’s an oasis of peace.
title: Stunning view

text: I had an amazing experience at EKHO Ella. The staff were the friendliest most accommodating people I have had the pleasure of meeting. We had delicious food at the restaurant and was served by efficient and excellent staff Janith and Dinesh. They were most kind and conversational giving tips on best places to visit during our stay. We also were guided by some of the other management staff, Priyantha and Nilkanthi who were most helpful. Priyantha was even so kind to escort me and my mother at night into town to ensure our safety as we were worried. The staff went above and beyond. Other than that the hotel was amazing, room was top quality along with the amazing views of the Ella Mountains. Very centrally located and walking distance to many shops and close by to 9 arch bridge and little Adam’s peak. Highly recommended will be visiting again.
title: Amazing Staff, View and Stay

placeInfo: {'id': '14968612', 'name': 'EKHO Ella', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 637, 'locationString': 'Ella, Uva Province', 'latitude': 6.87107, 'longitude': 81.04919, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g616035-d14968612-Reviews-EKHO_Ella-Ella_Uva_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.ekhohotels.com/ekhoella/', 'address': 'EKHO Ella, Sandungama Rd Ella, Sri Lanka, Ella 90090 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'EKHO Ella, Sandungama Rd Ella, Sri Lanka', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Ella', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '90090'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 2, 'count2': 8, 'count3': 11, 'count4': 55, 'count5': 562}}
text:
The staff at Ekho Ella were fantastic and accommodating. Priyantha, Krishan, Sujeewa and Thakshila did a amazing job of making our stay super comfortable. The hotel's location, on the site of a former Rest House, is possibly the best view in Ella and waking up to the sunrise over the Ella Gap was incredible. Breakfast and dinner in the traditional open wall dinning area was just wonderful with views of the Gap and the gardens as the sun goes down. The food was delicious and the staff made sure to take dietary requirements/allergies into consideration and make personalised modifications where appropriate. While the Ella town strip has a number of adequate restaurants and cafes there was really no need to eat anywhere else than at Ekho as their food was so good. Thanks for an 
amazing stay.
title: Amazing service at EKHO Ella

placeInfo: {'id': '14968612', 'name': 'EKHO Ella', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 637, 'locationString': 'Ella, Uva Province', 'latitude': 6.87107, 'longitude': 81.04919, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g616035-d14968612-Reviews-EKHO_Ella-Ella_Uva_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.ekhohotels.com/ekhoella/', 'address': 'EKHO Ella, Sandungama Rd Ella, Sri Lanka, Ella 90090 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'EKHO Ella, Sandungama Rd Ella, Sri Lanka', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Ella', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '90090'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 2, 'count2': 8, 'count3': 11, 'count4': 55, 'count5': 562}}
text:
Wonderful Stay at EKHO Ella with a Stunning View and made a history to my life!

We stayed for three nights at EKHO Ella, Sri Lanka, and it was an unforgettable experience. We are from Sydney and had asked a friend, who also lives in Sydney, to book a hotel for us in Ella. My main request was to find a place where we could relax and enjoy a beautiful view from our room. My friend booked EKHO Ella, and I couldn’t have been happier with the choice!

From the moment we arrived, the welcome drinks, traditional Sri Lankan pancakes, and herbal drinks set the tone for a wonderful stay. The hotel staff were incredibly warm and attentive, and when they showed us to our room, I was thrilled with what I saw.

The room was designed with inspiration from the famous Ella train and station, and the setup was truly remarkable. The view from the room was breath-taking, and the thoughtful design made our stay even more special. There are no words to fully express how impressive and well-thought-out the room design was – it felt like a perfect blend of comfort and creativity.

On the first night, we had booked dinner for my wife, my friend, and his wife. However, when we arrived, we noticed there weren’t many vegetarian options available. Fortunately, the hotel’s General Manager, Mr. Udesh Sasanka, noticed this and quickly requested the chef to prepare three additional vegetarian dishes for us. This level of personalized attention truly showed how much they care about meeting each guest’s needs. The hotel also organized live flute music, creating a romantic atmosphere that enhanced our evening with beautiful sounds.

The next day, unfortunately, I had an accident after using the jacuzzi and needed to be rushed to the hospital for stitches. One of the hotel staff members, Mr. Priyantha, was incredible in this emergency. He kept pressure on my bleeding ear and held me on his lap until we reached the hospital. It was a serious injury, requiring 10 stitches, and I had to stay at the hospital overnight. Mr. Priyantha stayed by my side the entire night, without sleeping, helping me until the next morning when my wife and friend arrived. His care and dedication in such a stressful situation were remarkable, and I cannot thank him enough.

The entire hotel staff went above and beyond during this difficult time. They even organized a dinner for me and breakfast following day at the hospital, providing linens and pillows to ensure my comfort. Mr. Udesh Sasaka and his team visited me at the hospital the next morning, even though it was more than 45 minutes away from the hotel. Their kindness and concern were truly touching. After I was discharged, Mr. Udesh arranged a special lunch served on a banana leaf, a dish I love, which he learned about from my friend. It was such a thoughtful gesture and made the whole experience unforgettable.

I want to extend my heartfelt thanks to the entire hotel staff and General Manager for the extraordinary care and service they provided. Even after returning to Sydney, Mr. Priyantha continues to check on me daily, sending messages to see how I am recovering. His compassion and humanity are rare in this world, and I feel incredibly fortunate to have encountered such wonderful people.

I also want to acknowledge the staff members who made our stay so memorable:

Udesh Sasanka GM
Priyantha
Thakshila
Nilakshi
Shelani
Dinesh
Sujeewa
Mahesh
Krishan
Sanjeewa
Nethmi
Janith
This was truly an unforgettable experience, and I highly recommend EKHO Ella to anyone looking for exceptional service and hospitality. On our next trip to Sri Lanka, we will definitely stay at EKHO Ella again to enjoy another unforgettable experience

From Suresh & Sivaja from Sydney Australia - 21/09/2024
title: Wonderful Stay at EKHO Ella with a Stunning View, Making History in My Life!

roomTip: High elevation - pack a sweater / light jacket regardless of time of year
text:
I was absolutely blown away by our recent stay at 98 Acres - arguably one of, if not the best hotel in Ella. 

From the moment we arrived, we were warmly greeted and quickly checked in. We were given a traditional Sri Lankan blessing/welcome and quickly shown to our room - 100 - which had stunning views overlooking the mountain range and valley below. The room was beyond spacious and featured a super comfortable bed, and a massive bathroom with walk-in shower. I really appreciated the resort's emphasis on sustainability, as all of the bathroom amenities were in recycled packaging and also seemed local/homemade. The property tries very heavily to not rely on or utilize plastic where possible. 

The entire resort is situated cliff side, ensuring that each room has impeccable and unobstructed views. It was so remarkable to wake up each morning and just sit on the balcony as the sun was rising, and just being in nature. Natural sounds of birds chirping, tea pickers showing up for work and starting their day, etc. Just remarkable.

We used the pool area, which is nicely set up with lounge chairs, and day beds. It was also a great place to order a beer and cocktail and continue taking in the views. 

While we were only at 98 Acres for one night, both dinner and breakfast were included in our package and both were awesome. Dinner was from a set menu, and the restaurant was a perfect place to eat a tasty and sizable meal, with the choice of being indoors or outdoors. Breakfast was buffet style, and had a wide array of options which was enjoyable. Satith was our server for breakfast and super attentive and also encouraged us to try the tea - which is from the resort's own tea plantation - and that little touch / recommendation made the stay that much more memorable. 

Before departing we did have the opportunity to visit the spa and have a 60 minute massage. It was AMAZING - the spa rooms overlook the tea plantation making for a good view at the start, and our massage therapists were fantastic. The massage was exceptionally affordable (by US standards), but highly recommend making reservations early or right at arrival. We didn't expect the spa to be booked up, but it was, and we had to settle for a 9am appointment on our departure day. 

Highly recommend 98 Acres - by western standards it's a 4 star property that is very much operating as a 5 start facility. Their attention to detail (down to bestowing a bag of their house tea to each guest at departure) was noted and so appreciated. More than anything, the genuine service of the staff is what left a lasting mark on us, and if we find ourselves in Ella again, this will be where we call home again.
title: A Highlight Of Our Sri Lanka Trip!

text: Stunning scenery but a very average, pleasant hotel. Rooms are set in the hillside, so it feels nice and private. Staff are very friendly, as are most in Sri Lanka. However,  I found the quality of the hotel very average for the very high coat of staying here. They are certainly making the most of the great location they have and are charging accordingly.  Bed sheets and bath products okay but have been using my own, drinks and food in the hotel are very expensive,  it's so much cheaper to get a tuk tuk into Ella and eat at one of the many good restaurants.  Don't think I'd come back here, but it was good to experience it.
title: Average hotel. Stunning location.

text:
This resort is in the most beautiful setting covering 98 acres.
Glamping pods nearby.
The views are spectacular with a swimming pool,  bar with dance floor and dj playing throughout the day.

The path to Little Adams peak passes here for even more spectacular views.
Tuk Tuks are available  to take you part of the way.
Would not recommend for anyone with mobility issues due to the terrain.

text: We had an amazing time at 98 Acres. We stayed in a honeymoon suite which was very spacious with a stunning view. this is one of the most beautiful hotels i’ve ever been to.
located in the middle of the mountains it offers an incredible view of the surroundings, at sunset and sunrise.
since the rooms can be a bit far from
the main areas (reception, restaurant, pool) you can ask for buggy ride.

the balcony was enormous and so
was the bathroom.

it’s a pity we had to leave so early, we’d loved to have enjoyed it longer.
they prepared us a breakfast box full of tasteful things.

text:
98 acres hotel, situated on the mountain top overlooking the valley below and with a birds eye view of Little Adam's peak , was ours first choice for a stay in the famous area of Ella. We checked in Early September as part of our trip to various places in Sri lanka and stayed at the hotel for a comfortable 3 nights. The bedrooms were spacious with a large balcony overlooking the tea garden below, a really pleasant sight to wake upto every morning. 
The service from all the staff was of pure hospitality and attentiveness, all showing the guests ,including us , an overall impressive impression. Special mention and a big thank you from us to Mr Upali Dissanayake of the Reservation Executive who really  helped us with the bookings of the rooms and guided us from the day of check in right upto the check out date and time, also helping guide us to the main attractions of Ella that we would have otherwise missed out on. Food at the main dining area was very good and freshly served at a very reasonable cost.
Overall , a very good place to stay in and would definitely go back anytime we do plan a visit to Ella.
title: Sri Lanka Trip.

placeInfo: {'id': '2664481', 'name': '98 Acres Resort & Spa', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 2781, 'locationString': 'Ella, Uva Province', 'latitude': 6.87102, 'longitude': 81.06258, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g616035-d2664481-Reviews-98_Acres_Resort_Spa-Ella_Uva_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.resort98acres.com', 'address': 'Passara / Namunukula Road Greenland Estate, Ella 90090 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Passara / Namunukula Road', 'street2': 'Greenland Estate', 'city': 'Ella', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '90090'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 44, 'count2': 78, 'count3': 181, 'count4': 538, 'count5': 1943}}
text:
My friends and myself booked the 98 acres hotel upon going through most of the reviews about the property and it really lived upto our expectations. The check in was smooth and fast, staff at the lobby and check in counter were attentive and courteous. The property is situated on a high mountain top and the property grounds are huge with a commanding view of the surrounding valley and mountains. A superb location for nature lovers. The most important point that every future guest booking this property needs to be aware of is there is no air condition in all the rooms. Its more of an eco friendly property and the weather in Ella being mostly cool, i guess the room fans does most of the work even though all of our group friends and myself were pretty taken aback at there being no aircon in a 4 star hotel.
The rooms were spacious with a big balcony overlooking the tea fields below the rooms and the mountain ranges view right ahead, the only issue about the rooms are the amount of bugs, insects and small moths that quickly make their way into the room even if the balcony door is opened for a short period of time, very inconvenient to myself and my friends,m especially at night before sleeping .
The overall staff that handles the buggy service to and rom the rooms , the dining staff were all courteous and helpful to all our needs. Breakfast was good with quite a few varieties of dishes available. The hotel spa was a nice relaxing experience, very reasonable with a commanding view of Adans peak. The hotel is about 3 km from the main town of Ella where all the restaurants are situated, not very far by car. There is the Ravana zipline and the Ravana Pool Club next to the hotel premises, plus the walk or hike to Adams peak starts a bit further down from the hotel so thats an added bonus to the guests . One of the good hotels to stay in if anyone planning a trio to Ella.
title: Couples Trip to Sri lanka

roomTip: Make sure you get the rooms with a view of little adam's peak
text:
This is arguably my favourite resort in all of Sri Lanka, and it was a huge pity that we were here for just the 1 night. The views are amazing, and we happened to be here during the night of the full moon, so the views were even more stunning and mesmerising. 

An added bonus is being able to see the scenery from the comfort of your own bed. The bed and pillows were both extremely comfortable, and the room came with great amenities. The shower was enormous, and the food provided during dinner time was one of my favourite in Sri Lanka. 

Staff were polite, kind, and very knowledgable.
title: a must stay!

ownerResponse:
{'id': '966502688', 'text': "Dear Tracey,

Thank you for taking the time to share your detailed feedback. I'm truly sorry to hear that your stay did not meet your expectations and that you encountered so many issues during your visit.

I sincerely apologize for the discomfort and inconvenience you experienced, from the lack of air conditioning and noise disturbances to the situation in the restaurant. Your experience is certainly not what we strive to provide our guests, and I deeply regret that we fell short in so many areas.

As an eco-friendly resort located in an area with generally comfortable weather, we have not installed air conditioning in our rooms. However, due to global warming, we recognize that the daytime temperatures can be warmer than expected. We are seriously considering installing air conditioning in all our rooms to enhance our guests' comfort.

We are also sorry to hear that you were disturbed by the music from the Ravana Pool Club, which is located on the other side of the mountain which is operating only during the daytime. 
We will definitely look into ways to reduce the noise in our rooms to ensure a more peaceful and relaxing stay.

Please know that your comments have been taken seriously, and we will be addressing each of these concerns with the appropriate teams to ensure improvements are made.

If there is anything further you would like to discuss, please do not hesitate to contact me directly at fom@resort98acres.com. I appreciate your feedback and hope that we can regain your trust in the future.

Best regards,  

Sachitha Amarasinghe
Front Office Manager

placeInfo: {'id': '2664481', 'name': '98 Acres Resort & Spa', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 2781, 'locationString': 'Ella, Uva Province', 'latitude': 6.87102, 'longitude': 81.06258, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g616035-d2664481-Reviews-98_Acres_Resort_Spa-Ella_Uva_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.resort98acres.com', 'address': 'Passara / Namunukula Road Greenland Estate, Ella 90090 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Passara / Namunukula Road', 'street2': 'Greenland Estate', 'city': 'Ella', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '90090'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 44, 'count2': 78, 'count3': 181, 'count4': 538, 'count5': 1943}}
roomTip: No airc-onditioning means you will sweat all night! Bugs everywhere, and VERY, VERY noisey!
text:
Seriously, don't waste your money. There are so many reasons, I will need to use dot points!
- there is no air conditioning and no fly-screens, only a fan. It gets HOT in Ella, so we were grossly uncomfortable the entire stay (it is in the hills, so bugs everywhere)
- the rooms are NOISEY! There is a HORRENDOUS club within a few minutes walk of the property, and you can hear the thud-thud of music all day and into the night. It is truly awful. When we arrived (after many emails requesting a quiet room), we were placed in a downstairs room with a group in the room above us. The rooms have timber floors so the scraping of furniture and walking was incessant. There were also builders directly under our balcony, using a circular saw, so all the dust came up in to our room. After MUCH discussion, we were finally allowed to move into a different area of the property. While you couldn't hear the horrible music from the club, it still wasn't near to being peaceful and relaxing. 
- the tv is in a small little area off to the side. The fan does not reach there and the sofa is very hard. A gecko lived in the ceiling, so we got pooped on twice! You cannot see the TV from the bed. 
- there is a very busy road going right through the property. There are people and tuk-tuks travelling along it at all hours.
- the majority of the rooms are all on top of each other - there are 4 rooms to a double storey building with wooden floors, so the noise is awful.
- but, one of the main reasons we would never step foot in this place again is the owner and his son and daughter-in-law. We went for dinner in the restaurant and the owner and family were also dining there. They waltzed in with their young daughter - maybe 4 years old, and two nanny's. While the owner, son and daughter-in-law sat down to eat, the nanny's and little girl were left without food or drink in the lounge area. The parents quite literally had their backs to her! The little girl created havoc in the restaurant and was being chased everywhere by the nanny - it was after 8pm, so the poor little girl should have been in bed. The parents ignored her, and every time she tried to go near them, they turned her around and called the nanny to come and get her! The entire dining room was disgusted! The mother was too busy trying to be gorgeous, and the father was on the phone half the time. 
- The owner obviously went for style (although there wasn't much) over substance, because the entire place was extremely impractical and uncomfortable. They obviously don't care about the experience of their guests, only the money they bring in.....thus building a loud, tacky club right next door!
title: NOT relaxing, NOT luxury, don't waste your money!

roomTip: Avoid the Ella backpackers pool party venue
text:
Staff were great the service was very good the shuttle and bar staff did very well , but it struggles to know what it wants to be , the thoroughfare through the middle of the resort to the backpackers pool party bar owned by the hotel  detracts from its attempts at exclusivity , the pool is almost complete and there is extensive building ongoing around the place which is good  as they are investing , but the rooms are big but a slight bit shabby , views obscured on 1st floors by unkept newly planted trees . All
In all compared to Cinnamon or Jetwing it needs a good polish , nearly there but more effort required .please re thatch the roofs the lodges look awful with the plastic sticking through and rotting rushes .
title: Good but needs a good polish to get in the top league

text:
My favourite hotel of our whole holiday in Sri Lanka. We stayed in 4 other 5 star hotels but this was by far my favourite. 
The lodge had a roll out bed to roll the bed outside on the deck. We rolled it out on the morning to watch the sunrise. There was a hammock to look out at the view. The room was beautiful. We had an amazing stay I was only sad we didn’t stay longer to make use of the pool and zip line. 

The restaurant has amazing gluten free options for breakfast and dinner - the chef took me around the buffet and talked me through my options and they brought me out gluten free bread. They special cooked items for me too. 

The staff were fantastic, they took us on a buggy to our lodge, brought bags in, did dry cleaning quickly and efficiently.
title: The best hotel!!

text:
We visited with a large group of friends from Australia over Xmas. Having already fallen in love with the country I was blown away by 98 Acres. The rooms are stunning, if you’re lucky enough to have a roll out bed there is no experience like sitting on your bed looking at the stunning views of Ella. 

We had incredibly good food at the restaurant and every staff member was kind, friendly and very helpful. The spa was one of the best experiences for all of us on the whole Sri Lankan trip. 

The transport between amenities is brilliant - no trying to navigate steep climbs in the dark after a few beers! The prices were so incredibly good for the accommodation and the services. 

If we return to Sri Lanka which I plan to - we will absolutely return to 98 Acres.
title: Cannot Recommend More Highly

roomTip: Make sure ALL the building work has been finished before you go
text:
This hotel is wonderfully situated and the views are stunning. The staff are incredibly helpful and welcoming. The rooms are spacious, Clean and comfortable. You can walk easily to Little Adam’s peak. 

Unfortunately all of the above is marred by the heavy building works. Restaurant, pool all closed for renovation. Which we knew about - but there was also more building work around the rooms. Which meant you could not easily relax on your balcony and enjoy the views because of the sound of building from 8am - 6pm. We were placed next to a new block build. 

The upgrade to Ravana pool club is not an upgrade in our eyes. Unless being by a pool with loud music and drunk backpackers is your thing. Not a great environment for people with children. 

This is the only hotel - which on check out did not ask us how our stay was or to give feedback. It’s because they don’t want to hear it. 

This will be an amazing place once all the building has been finished and pool is open again. It’s a beautiful spot. It’s just a shame that the above distracted from the positives.
title: Mixed feelings

placeInfo: {'id': '2664481', 'name': '98 Acres Resort & Spa', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 2781, 'locationString': 'Ella, Uva Province', 'latitude': 6.87102, 'longitude': 81.06258, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g616035-d2664481-Reviews-98_Acres_Resort_Spa-Ella_Uva_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.resort98acres.com', 'address': 'Passara / Namunukula Road Greenland Estate, Ella 90090 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Passara / Namunukula Road', 'street2': 'Greenland Estate', 'city': 'Ella', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '90090'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 44, 'count2': 78, 'count3': 181, 'count4': 538, 'count5': 1943}}
text:
Our stay at 98 Acres Hotel in Ella was absolutely fantastic! From the moment we arrived, we were mesmerized by the stunning views of the lush tea plantations surrounding the property. The hotel’s design beautifully complements the natural landscape, creating a tranquil and picturesque atmosphere. Riding to our room in a golf buggy added an extra touch of excitement for the whole family.

Our room was spacious and beautifully decorated, equipped with modern amenities and a cozy ambiance. The large windows provided breathtaking views of the mountains and tea fields, making every moment special. Relaxing on the large swinging ottoman while listening to nature was truly amazing. The bed was incredibly comfortable, ensuring a restful night’s sleep. It’s worth noting that none of the rooms are air-conditioned, but we didn’t find it necessary, as the temperature was around 18 degrees at night.

The staff at 98 Acres were exceptional—always warm, friendly, and eager to help with any requests. The dining experience was delightful, featuring a diverse menu that showcased delicious local cuisine alongside international favorites. Each meal was thoughtfully prepared and beautifully presented.

The location is perfect for exploring Ella, with easy access to popular attractions like Little Adam’s Peak and the Nine Arches Bridge. After a day of hiking, it was wonderful to unwind in the serene environment of the hotel.

I highly recommend 98 Acres Hotel to anyone visiting Ella. It was a memorable experience, and I can’t wait to return!
title: Amazing views!

placeInfo: {'id': '2664481', 'name': '98 Acres Resort & Spa', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 2781, 'locationString': 'Ella, Uva Province', 'latitude': 6.87102, 'longitude': 81.06258, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g616035-d2664481-Reviews-98_Acres_Resort_Spa-Ella_Uva_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.resort98acres.com', 'address': 'Passara / Namunukula Road Greenland Estate, Ella 90090 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Passara / Namunukula Road', 'street2': 'Greenland Estate', 'city': 'Ella', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '90090'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 44, 'count2': 78, 'count3': 181, 'count4': 538, 'count5': 1943}}
text:
We stayed 2 nights at 98 Acres Resort & Spa. The hotel has a fantastic location and the service is impecable. The staff are attentive, friendly and proactive. The room was large with a very nice bathroom and a balcony where you can relax with a fantastic view.

Unfortunately the hotel restaurant and pool area was closed due to renovations and we were given access to the pool and restaurant in the next door Ravana Pool Club instead. We were not informed about this until the day of check-in which is really bad, they should have atleast emailed all guests about such a change. The Ravana Pool Club is a party place with really loud music during the day. It is not a relaxing pool experience,  which we were expecting at this resort. But we raised our dissatisfaction with the staff and we agreed on a compensation. They were understanding and apologetic about the situation.

Overall i would recommend this hotel, though not while it is under renovation.
title: Luxurious hotel with a fantastic view

placeInfo: {'id': '2664481', 'name': '98 Acres Resort & Spa', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 2781, 'locationString': 'Ella, Uva Province', 'latitude': 6.87102, 'longitude': 81.06258, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g616035-d2664481-Reviews-98_Acres_Resort_Spa-Ella_Uva_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.resort98acres.com', 'address': 'Passara / Namunukula Road Greenland Estate, Ella 90090 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Passara / Namunukula Road', 'street2': 'Greenland Estate', 'city': 'Ella', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '90090'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 44, 'count2': 78, 'count3': 181, 'count4': 538, 'count5': 1943}}
roomTip: Adam’s peak and Nine Arch Bridge are within walking distance and are a must do/see!
text:
Not sure if I can think of the words to describe how unbelievably spectacular this place is.

From the moment you arrive you are tended to by gracious, friendly, attentive, dutiful staff. They really went out of their way to ensure we were well looked after at all times, and they treated our little boy (coming up to 2yo) in such a friendly and heartwarming way. Clearly the hotel has a warm and family-friendly culture.

The views from our room (and everywhere on the premises) are impossibly beautiful, none more so than from the pool club. The pool club offers stunning vistas overlooking glorious mountains and valleys (ie: the same landscape you would see from Adam’s peak). The hotel is relatively prohibitive in terms of prices for rooms so the guests are typically older (as in, not teenagers on a gap year) but the bar pulls in younger travellers who have climbed the peak. 98 acres caters for this group in a very creative and savvy way by making it more of a young and club vibe, with live DJ set and decor to match the crowd etc. Not to everyone’s taste but it didn’t detract from our experience.

The food is amazing, especially the local cuisine, and despite what other reviews have said, we found the bar and restaurant staff to be thoroughly friendly and lived up to expectations (and beyond).

Although this place doesn’t market itself as a wellness retreat, with the surroundings it boasts, it could well be. Our room didn’t have aircon but the temperature isn’t unbearable thanks to the altitude, so the fan alone sufficed. Overall we could not have enjoyed our time more, and we only wish we were staying a bit longer. We’ll be back!

Thank you, 98 acres, for being a highlight of our time in your beautiful country, and playing host to some cherished memories which we will treasure!
title: The most incredible place you could imagine

placeInfo: {'id': '23895393', 'name': 'HIDE-ELLA Hotel & Resort', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 186, 'locationString': 'Ella, Uva Province', 'latitude': 6.87223, 'longitude': 81.04667, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g616035-d23895393-Reviews-HIDE_ELLA_Hotel_Resort-Ella_Uva_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.hideella.com/', 'address': 'Waterfall Road Wemulhena, Ella 90090 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Waterfall Road', 'street2': 'Wemulhena', 'city': 'Ella', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '90090'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 7, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 13, 'count4': 32, 'count5': 131}}
text:
We stayed at Hide Ella for 2 nights and really enjoyed our time there. The hotel is modern and trendy, which was a refreshing change from the more traditional-style hotels we had stayed in throughout Sri Lanka. 

The staff was very friendly and one of the managers kindly helped us arrange a tuk-tuk tour to visit local highlights, as well as a private transfer to our next destination.

We stayed in a deluxe room on the basement floor, right next to the beautiful pool. However, we didn’t realize beforehand that there’s an entrance fee to use the pool, with packages available for access to the sauna and steam room as well. The hotel also has a small entertainment area with a billiard table, foosball, and a dartboard, which was a fun (free) touch.

Our room overlooked the valley with Ella’s Rock on one side and Little Adam’s Peak on the other. Occasionally, we had a visit from a toque macaque on our balcony, which made for a great view! The facilities were clean and well-kept, though we found the bed/mattress a bit too firm for our preference.

The skybar and dining area provided spectacular views, with a wide variety of dishes to choose from. Breakfast was served buffet-style with plenty of options, including an omelet station. The staff were particularly kind to us, a special thanks to Waruna, Vino and Lahiru for their service.

In terms of location; Hide Ella is located on top of a hill, offering breathtaking views while still being quite accessible. It’s just a 4-minute walk downhill to the main street where you will find shops, supermarkets, multiple ATM’s and restaurants. Uphill might take a minute or two longer. 

Overall, Hide Ella was a lovely, modern alternative to the traditional hotels in Sri Lanka, and we would highly recommend it for its friendly service and stunning views!
title: Modern hotel with stunning views!

roomTip: Short walk to the shops, bars, restaurants and cafes.  Great location.
text: We had a wonderful stay at Hide Ella.  The property is built to enhance and appreciate the beautiful views all around the hotel.  The views are amazing from the room, roof top, restaurants and anywhere you go within the hotel.  The food was amazing we had dinner and breakfast.  Special thanks to Vino, Shaan and Waruna.  Lovely staff and looked after us during meals.  Also special thanks to Janak and Ramesh.  They have been very helpful.  It’s only a short walk to the town and you get everything you need.  We also booked a tuk tuk ride from the hotel to Nine Arch bridge which is a must see.  The road going up to the hotel is incredibly steep, we felt we had a work out after our evening snacks going back to the hotel.  We didn’t find the rooms to be comfortable, the beds were average and the room size quite small.  This hotel is all about the views, staff and the food.  The breakfast was served outside where you could appreciate the fresh air and the beautiful views, this was definitely the highlight for me.
title: It’s all about the views !!!

placeInfo: {'id': '23895393', 'name': 'HIDE-ELLA Hotel & Resort', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 186, 'locationString': 'Ella, Uva Province', 'latitude': 6.87223, 'longitude': 81.04667, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g616035-d23895393-Reviews-HIDE_ELLA_Hotel_Resort-Ella_Uva_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.hideella.com/', 'address': 'Waterfall Road Wemulhena, Ella 90090 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Waterfall Road', 'street2': 'Wemulhena', 'city': 'Ella', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '90090'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 7, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 13, 'count4': 32, 'count5': 131}}
text:
On arrival we checked in, room wasn’t very clean hairs in the bathroom and bed. We spoke to reception they rectified it. The noise of people playing ping pong fairly late at night, the doors are very thin and you can hear pretty much everything. The walls in the bedroom were very marked- in need of a repaint. The shower plug was very dirty which meant the water wasn’t draining well and leaked on to the bathroom floor. 
The breakfast was average- again with the breakfast being outside our room an early wake up was on the cards. 
Overall disappointment and underwhelmed as this was the hotel we were looking forward to the most. 
Views from the bedroom were incredible! 
And they also did us a sandwich when we had a really early check out which was very much appreciated.
title: Average hotel but incredible view.

roomTip: Don’t leave anything outside. The monkey’s will take it!
text: We stayed for 3 nights in September opting for a room with balcony. The hotel is literally perched on a hillside about 100m back from the main road thru Ella. The room was nice and the view from bedroom window amazing. However, minor details let it down eg. the combination function didn’t work on the room safe, we were given the override key on check in, and the mini bar wasn’t stocked as per the attached price list. That said, the staff were friendly and the food good, and I’d return for another stay
title: Funky hotel with amazing views

text: Hide Ella was one of our favourite stops on our honeymoon. The views from the room were incredible and we could watch the monkeys playing in the trees. It is well situated, a short walk down the hill takes you to the bustling streets of fantastic restaurants and cafes. Flying Ravana and Little Adam's Peak are also walkable. Walking back up to the hotel is fairly steep but there are endless Tuk Tuks available to jump into. Staff were incredibly kind and attentive and even brought out a birthday cake for me at breakfast. Excellent mojitos in the Sky Bar on the top floor! Many thanks to Wazuna and Shaan
title: Great location, modern and clean.

text:
What a surprise!! The view is simply breathtaking from this hotel. A great location. The walk into town is about 5mins up and down a windy road. 
The going is steep coming back to the hotel but a tuk tuk will bring you back for 500rp no problem. We loved the breakfast at Hide - an open air balcony overlooking the infinity pool set amongst the lush trees. Tropical fruits, Sri Lankan omelettes and coffee were served by the friendliest of wait staff. Thank you Pushpa, Chamil, Lahiru and Dilshan and all the helpful staff at Hide for looking after us so well! 
Highly recommend if you are looking for a quiet place in Ella with incredible views!
title: Stunning Views

We had our enjoyable stay at Hide Ella. Very grateful to Manoj who helped us from beginning to end. He helped us with midnight airport transfer with a pit stop at Sirigiya which allowed us to hike up early morning to view sunrise. We had a pleasant surprise with this lovely family room. Many thanks to staff here at Hide Ella. 

We had great service esp Chamil who served us during our meals at breakfast and dinner. 
I was looking for string Hoppers which I used to enjoy during childhood.. it was another surprise that Lalith the chef made for us on our last day of breakfast. 

All the staff were very accommodating  and kind to us, especially our tour guide and the people who drove us to and fro. Facilities were good and the food is high quality.

placeInfo: {'id': '23895393', 'name': 'HIDE-ELLA Hotel & Resort', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 186, 'locationString': 'Ella, Uva Province', 'latitude': 6.87223, 'longitude': 81.04667, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g616035-d23895393-Reviews-HIDE_ELLA_Hotel_Resort-Ella_Uva_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.hideella.com/', 'address': 'Waterfall Road Wemulhena, Ella 90090 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Waterfall Road', 'street2': 'Wemulhena', 'city': 'Ella', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '90090'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 7, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 13, 'count4': 32, 'count5': 131}}
text:
Hide Ella has a great and friendly staff ready to assist and welcome you at any given time. It is a place of accommodation with a relatively modern infrastructure and is located at the heart to nearby tourist destinations.

With a good 15 min walk you can reach the main gate to Ella train station and descending some 100 stairs you can see the famous 9 Arch Bridge. It is also close by to some amazing cafe places nearby.

However make sure to have your dinner at Hide Ella for 1 night to experience the rich platter of food they serve. Some food recommendations are to ask for coconut chutney for breakfast, chicken soup for dinner, pineapple chicken salad, white wine and appam.

They have plenty many other leisure retreats such as Jacuzzi, Sauna Room, Swimming Pool and Spa services at very reasonably nominal prices.

It is a must visit stay to experience Ella more leisurely. The hotel is dedicated to make your stay in Ella more comfortable and memorable.
title: Must Visit - Great Food - Chill Vibes - Amazing Hospitality - Extremely Well Connected with City

placeInfo: {'id': '23895393', 'name': 'HIDE-ELLA Hotel & Resort', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 186, 'locationString': 'Ella, Uva Province', 'latitude': 6.87223, 'longitude': 81.04667, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g616035-d23895393-Reviews-HIDE_ELLA_Hotel_Resort-Ella_Uva_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.hideella.com/', 'address': 'Waterfall Road Wemulhena, Ella 90090 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Waterfall Road', 'street2': 'Wemulhena', 'city': 'Ella', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '90090'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 7, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 13, 'count4': 32, 'count5': 131}}
text:
I stayed for 1 night, presumably for the same reason you are considering to book - the spectacular views. Ill give Hide Ella that; the view from the lobby is indeed stunning - sadly that's where the positives for this hotel come to a dramatic end. 

The view from my room is attached, and I was 2 floors up from the lowest floor (so it can get quite a bit worse than the photo).

Its not all doom and gloom though, i have good news for you! If you fancy a different room you can just walk straight into whichever room you want, because there are no keys. Luckily the pass codes to each room are so easy to guess that a small child could figure them out (even though the front office staff promised me that they change them for each and every guest). Dont take my word for it though... Just add 000* to the last number of the room number you want, and voila, a complimentary upgrade!  No need to thank me, just be sure to thank the management for taking security so seriously. I was lucky enough to to have the staff smoking area 3 meters from my room (#309), so always had the pleasure of someone's gaze as I plugged my "9", followed by "000*" to get into my room. 

I would have posted this review while staying at the hotel, but sadly the wifi didn't work for the last 12+ hours of our stay. I recognize that this isn't necessarily a deal breaker, as wifi is not really an integral part of modern day life, particularly when traveling internationally. It wasn't just my room, we traveled as a group, and all had the same issue. Wifi didn't work in the lobby or restaurant either. 

Some other reasons for this being one of my favourite hotels I ever stayed at are; 

1. If you want a cappuccino or latte at breakfast it's not included, so make sure to bring some extra cash for that one! 

2. They lack the warm hospitality experienced everywhere else in Sri Lanka. I had the chance to talk to a few Sri-lankans who work in the industry and they had nothing but bad things to say about the hospitality and care provided by the property. 

3. The hotel boasts its integration with the natural surroundings, and it's commitment to the environment. The amenities are boxed in very sexy, eco-friendly looking packaging. To the untrained skeptic, it's looks so instagramable that mother nature herself might shed a small tear of joy. Open any box, however, to find more plastic than a coca-cola factory.

Stay somewhere else.
title: Stay somewhere else.

placeInfo: {'id': '23895393', 'name': 'HIDE-ELLA Hotel & Resort', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 186, 'locationString': 'Ella, Uva Province', 'latitude': 6.87223, 'longitude': 81.04667, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g616035-d23895393-Reviews-HIDE_ELLA_Hotel_Resort-Ella_Uva_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.hideella.com/', 'address': 'Waterfall Road Wemulhena, Ella 90090 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Waterfall Road', 'street2': 'Wemulhena', 'city': 'Ella', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '90090'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 7, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 13, 'count4': 32, 'count5': 131}}
text:
Hide Ella was a fabulous experience for us. We booked out 2 deluxe rooms. They were modern and spacious, with an outstanding view of the mountain region including Ella Rock. All the usual luxury amenities are available - including a hair dryer

We had the buffet breakfast here for 2 consecutive mornings.

Staff here were very attentive. In particular, Ragu’s level of service was exemplary. He made sure we had everything we needed, especially at meal times - the hoppers, omelette and vadai at breakfast were fresh out of the pan/fryer!!

Can recommend the meals and drinks here. Buffet breakfast is really expansive and varied across the 2 days we dined in - both Sri Lankan and western options available. Dinner here is also quite good and reasonably priced compared to the shops in downtown Ella.

A great luxury break!!
title: Luxurious experience at Hide Ella

placeInfo: {'id': '23895393', 'name': 'HIDE-ELLA Hotel & Resort', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 186, 'locationString': 'Ella, Uva Province', 'latitude': 6.87223, 'longitude': 81.04667, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g616035-d23895393-Reviews-HIDE_ELLA_Hotel_Resort-Ella_Uva_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.hideella.com/', 'address': 'Waterfall Road Wemulhena, Ella 90090 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Waterfall Road', 'street2': 'Wemulhena', 'city': 'Ella', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '90090'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 7, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 13, 'count4': 32, 'count5': 131}}
text:
We had a disappointing experience, especially in light of the price of the rooms.

The view is splendid, the rest really needs improvement. What really made our experience sour was the unfriendly staff and the poor quality of service. The rooms have a great potential but are not being maintained and are therefore in poor condition and disrepair. The water of the jacuzzi was black (we couldn’t see the bottom when off) and the steam room would not stay on and had a strong smell of humidity, showing that both are not being cleaned and aired regularly. They called us every day to ask when we would come to have breakfast/lunch/dinner (even though we had been made aware of opening times at check in) which was quite stressful. I booked a massage with the hotel, however no one told me it was going to be outside of the hotel, not even the receptionist with whom I booked who saw me coming to and waiting at reception in a bathrobe literally in front of his desk for 10 minutes... These are some examples of our two days stay at the hotel.

To top it off, they sent me a message after our departure to say that WE had forgotten to pay part of the bill. We thought that it was offered by the manager for all the inconveniences as they made us pay some drinks we had when we checked out (so THEY forgot to include the whole bill and then messaged me in an accusatory way). 

I spoke with the manager to explain all this and he provided answers to some of it; now let’s hope things are improved.
title: Disappointing, especially given the high price...

placeInfo: {'id': '23895393', 'name': 'HIDE-ELLA Hotel & Resort', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 186, 'locationString': 'Ella, Uva Province', 'latitude': 6.87223, 'longitude': 81.04667, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g616035-d23895393-Reviews-HIDE_ELLA_Hotel_Resort-Ella_Uva_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.hideella.com/', 'address': 'Waterfall Road Wemulhena, Ella 90090 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Waterfall Road', 'street2': 'Wemulhena', 'city': 'Ella', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '90090'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 7, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 13, 'count4': 32, 'count5': 131}}
roomTip: Book a room on a higher floor.
text:
An excellent hotel in Ella, capturing the two elements you would be looking for in the area: stunning view and opportunities to chill. It is located 10-15 minutes walking from the main street, it is an uphill walk so if you are not in the mood for it you can always take a tuk-tuk from the center to the hotel. 
The first thing that impresses is the view – it stunning. You can enjoy the view from the lobby, from your room or from the rooftop, just slurp your cocktail and stay in silence. The rooms are spacious and feel pretty new (the whole is actually pretty new as a whole). The take on the swimming pool is pretty intriguing, one would expect an infinity pool there, but this time it is on the ground floor and tucked between the trees. Generous breakfast, excellent service and just the perfect vibes.
It is not that I spent a lot of time in the hote with so many things to do in Ella and around Ella, but every minute I spend in the hotel was a minute of tranquility and enjoyment. Certainly, I would book it again if I return to Ella.
title: Stunning views, chill pool, nice service. Excellent experience.

placeInfo: {'id': '23895393', 'name': 'HIDE-ELLA Hotel & Resort', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 186, 'locationString': 'Ella, Uva Province', 'latitude': 6.87223, 'longitude': 81.04667, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g616035-d23895393-Reviews-HIDE_ELLA_Hotel_Resort-Ella_Uva_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.hideella.com/', 'address': 'Waterfall Road Wemulhena, Ella 90090 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Waterfall Road', 'street2': 'Wemulhena', 'city': 'Ella', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '90090'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 7, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 13, 'count4': 32, 'count5': 131}}
roomTip: Ask for roomd not on floor 4 . Breakfast served  right outside room.
text:
Just returned from two nights at the hotel.  It is a manageable 15 minute walk or 5 minute tuk tuk ride from the train station.

Check in was smooth and efficient. Views are amazing especially the one over the main reception area. 

Rooms as you would expect. Comfy beds. The digital hot water system in toilet would be good if there were some instructions- we managed fine but we had elderly parents in next room and they struggled till we assisted. To be fair their display was also not working. Water pressure and temperature excellent except in the sink where hot water was patchy.Wifi generally fine but had a couple of issues which were rectified immediately.
Highlight of stay other than the views was the food. We had breakfast and dinner at hotel both great. Only comments on breakfast it was served right outside level 4 which is where our rooms were and slightly disconcerting first morning to open door to see guests having breakfast outside our room. The other point was flies over the fruit and muffins- some sort of mesh to cover them would be more hygienic. Pool was lovely if a bit of debri in it. 
Staff were friendly and efficient.  On the whole the family had a lovely time. With the few improvements can be a 5 star experience. Would recommend and hope to be back next time in SL.
title: Few minor tweaks and it would be a five star experience

text: Brilliant stay at this beautiful hotel with stunning views. The hotel is built into the hill side on different levels and whilst it is small, it feels spacious because of the fantastic views all around. The small size also makes it feel welcoming and friendly. The food was delicious and all the staff were very helpful. A short 5 min walk down a steep hill to the main street and a quick tuk tuk back. Would definitely stay again.
title: Lovely hotel , stunning views

text: Our 2 days stay at Hide Ella was great.  The views from the open terrace and the rooms are stunning.  The room was modern and furnished well.  The staff were helpful and did their best to make our stay comfortable. Considering it a small hotel, there was ample variety at breakfast /dinner and the food /desserts were very good.  A special thanks to Chef Heshan for his exemplary culinary skills. The hotel is situated not too far from the Ella town. A perfect place to relax and enjoy the natural beauty around.
title: Cosy Hotel with Stunning Views

placeInfo: {'id': '23895393', 'name': 'HIDE-ELLA Hotel & Resort', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 186, 'locationString': 'Ella, Uva Province', 'latitude': 6.87223, 'longitude': 81.04667, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g616035-d23895393-Reviews-HIDE_ELLA_Hotel_Resort-Ella_Uva_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.hideella.com/', 'address': 'Waterfall Road Wemulhena, Ella 90090 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Waterfall Road', 'street2': 'Wemulhena', 'city': 'Ella', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '90090'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 7, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 13, 'count4': 32, 'count5': 131}}
text:
Having read some positive reviews booked this over others in Ella - but what a disappointing experience!
This was our 6th night in SL and we were really expecting something special (for the price) but failed to live up to our expectations.
Unfriendly staff on arrival, poor customer service and generally a bit of a let down.
Great views, yes. but tiny rooms (we had 2), no storage and cheap furniture (think Wayfair black and grey and you will get the picture!) Cold and dirty around pool. 
No slippers or bathrobes and had to ask about pool towels etc. Instead the focus by reception was on telling us that we would be charged $200 for any breakages incurred during our stay. 
Actually a bit of a sad and unhappy and soulless hotel - and a hike to get to it.
Breakfast was good but a bit weird eating outside bedrooms (4th floor). Had to be seen to be believed.
Look elsewhere.
title: Style Over Substance

text: A lovely boutique hotel with very modern rooms and restaurant. Our room had amazing views. The pool is surrounded by greenery. Restaurant is very nice and modern and the food was delicious and very nicely plated. I suggest to the hotel management to change the payment system to allow payment by Apple Pay or directly by swiping or tapping a credit card. Payment methods that require disclosure of the CVC code should not be used. Otherwise the hotel offered great hospitality and the chef was very attentive to food intolerances.
title: A lovely boutique hotel with great views

text:
Loved the architectural concept and admired the engineering.

Staff were accommodating and service was OK.

Our lowest level room had an incomplete exterior that was subject to workers going right by our window.

The room itself was sparse and didn’t “feel” comfortable.  It CERTAINLY did not pick up on the lushness of the environment or the coziness implied in the name “hide” Ella.
title: Impressive but stark

title: The best place to stay while in Ella
